class.name: Telerik.Data.DataSource
class.description: Initializes a new instance of the Telerik.Data.DataSource component.

constructor.description: Initializes a new instance of the Telerik.Data.DataSource component.

parameter.name: options
parameter.description: The configuration options for this DataSource component.

property.name: data
property.description: Gets or sets the underlying raw data array.

property.name: schema
property.description: Gets the object that describes the raw data format. Once configured through the constructor options, the schema is read-only.

property.name: transport
property.description: Gets or sets the object that describes how data is loaded from a remote endpoint. Once configured through the constructor options, the transport is read-only.

property.name: type
property.description: Gets or sets the name of a transport with preconfigured settings. Currently only "odata" is supported. Once configured through the constructor options, the transport type is read-only.

property.name: page
property.description: Gets or sets the page index. Default value is null.

property.name: pageSize
property.description: Gets or sets the number of items a page of data contains. Default value is null, indicating no paging is used.

property.name: filter
property.description: Gets or sets the filter descriptors. Accepts an object or an array of objects for multiple filter descriptors.

property.name: group
property.description: Gets or sets the group descriptors. Accepts an object or an array of objects for multiple group descriptors.

property.name: sort
property.description: Gets or sets the sort descriptors. Accepts an object or an array of objects for multiple sort descriptors.

property.name: aggregate
property.description: Gets or sets the aggregate descriptors. Accepts an object or an array of objects for multiple aggregate descriptors.

property.name: serverAggregates
property.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether aggregates should be calculated on the server when a remote endpoint is used.

property.name: serverFiltering
property.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether filtering should be applied on the server when a remote endpoint is used.

property.name: serverGrouping
property.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether grouping should be applied on the server when a remote endpoint is used.

property.name: serverPaging
property.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether paging should be applied on the server when a remote endpoint is used.

property.name: serverSorting
property.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether sorting should be applied on the server when a remote endpoint is used.

property.name: autoSync
property.description: Enables or disables the automatic invocation of the sync method after each change made to the data.

property.name: batch
property.description: Enables or disables batch mode.

property.name: totalPages
property.description: Retrieves the number of available pages.

property.name: total
property.description: Retrieves the total number of data records.

property.name: aggregates
property.description: Retrieves the result of aggregation.

property.name: view
property.description: Gets a view of the data with operations such as sorting, paging, filtering and grouping applied. To ensure data is available, this property should be used from within the change event of the data source, or from a success callback of the promise returned by a data-processing method such as fetch or read.

event.name: change
event.description: Fires when the underlying data is changed.

event.name: error
event.description: Fires when an error occurs during data retrieval.

event.name: requeststart
event.description: Fires before a data request is made.

event.name: requestend
event.description: Fires when a request ends.

event.name: sync
event.description: Fires after changes are synced.

method.name: at
method.description: Returns the data record at the specified index.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: The index of the data record to retrieve.

method.name: indexOf
method.description: Retrieve the index of a specified observable object from the underlying data.

parameter.name: model
parameter.description: The observable object whose index to retreive.

method.name: fetch
method.description: Fetches data using the current filter/sort/group/paging information. If data is not available or remote operations are enabled, data is requested through the transport, otherwise operations are executed over the available data.

method.name: read
method.description: Read the data into the DataSource using the transport read definition.

method.name: query
method.description: Executes a query over the data. Available operations are paging, sorting, filtering, grouping. If data is not available or remote operations are enabled, data is requested through the transport. Otherwise operations are executed over the available data.

parameter.name: options
parameter.description: Configuration options for this query. Contains page, sort, filter, group and aggregate descriptors.

method.name: add
method.description: Adds a new data item to the DataSource

parameter.name: model
parameter.description: The new data item to add.

method.name: insert
method.description: Inserts a new item into the DataSource at the specified index.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: The zero-based index of the position to insert.

parameter.name: model
parameter.description: The Javascript object to insert.

method.name: remove
method.description: Remove the specified item from the DataSource

parameter.name: model
parameter.description: The item to remove.

method.name: hasChanges
method.description: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether data in the DataSource have changed.

method.name: cancelChanges
method.description: Cancels any changes made to the data since the last sync.

parameter.name: model
parameter.description: Optional. The data item to cancel any changes for.

method.name: getById
method.description: Retrieves a model by a given ID.

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: The ID of the model to retrieve. The ID of a model is defined through the schema.model.id option.

method.name: getByUid
method.description: Retrieves a model by a its uid field.

parameter.name: uid
parameter.description: The uid of the item to retrieve.

method.name: sync
method.description: Synchronizes changes through the transport. Any pending CRUD operations will be sent to the server. If the DataSource is in batch mode, only one call will be made for each type of operation (Create, Update, Destroy). Otherwise, the DataSource will send one request per item change and change type.

method.name: clone
method.description: Clones this Telerik.Data.DataSource instance along with options and data.

class.name: Telerik.Data.dataStorageTransport
class.description: For internal use only. Creates a new instance of the Telerik.DataStorage transport for the DataSource component.

constructor.description: For internal use only. Creates a new instance of the Telerik.DataStorage transport for the DataSource component.

class.name: Telerik.UI.ListBase
class.description: Serves as a base class for the AutoComplete, DropDownList and ComboBox controls. For internal use only.

constructor.description: Serves as a base class for the AutoComplete, DropDownList and ComboBox controls. For internal use only.

parameter.name: element
parameter.description: The HTML element this control is associated with.

parameter.name: options
parameter.description: The initialization options for this control.

property.name: value
property.description: Gets or sets the value of the control.

property.name: animation
property.description: Gets the animation options to be used for opening/closing the popup.

property.name: autoBind
property.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to bind the widget to the dataSource on initialization.

property.name: dataSource
property.description: Gets or sets the data source of the control.

property.name: dataTextField
property.description: Gets or sets the field of the data item that provides the text content of the list items.

property.name: dataValueField
property.description: Gets or sets the field of the data item that provides the value content of the list items.

property.name: delay
property.description: Gets or sets the delay in ms after which the control will start filtering the dataSource.

property.name: enabled
property.description: Gets or sets the enabled state of the control.

property.name: height
property.description: Gets or sets the height of the drop-down list in pixels.

property.name: headerTemplate
property.description: Specifies a static HTML content, which will be rendered as a header of the popup element.

property.name: template
property.description: Gets or sets the template to be used for rendering the items in the list.

property.name: ignoreCase
property.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the search should be case sensitive.

property.name: isOpen
property.description: Gets a value indicating whether the list container is currently open.

property.name: readonly
property.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the control is read-only.

property.name: list
property.description: Gets the jQuery-wrapped list of items in the control.

property.name: element
property.description: Gets the DOM element that hosts this control.

property.name: initialized
property.description: Indicates whether the control is initialized.

event.name: change
event.description: Fires when the value of the control changes.

event.name: open
event.description: Fires when the drop-down list is shown.

event.name: close
event.description: Fires when the drop-down list is closed.

event.name: select
event.description: Fires when an item is selected from the drop-down list.

event.name: databinding
event.description: Fires when the control is about to databind.

event.name: databound
event.description: Fires immediately after the control is databound.

method.name: dataItem
method.description: Returns the raw data record at the specified index or the selected index.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: Optional. The zero-based index of the data record to retrieve.

method.name: refresh
method.description: Re-renders the items in the drop-down list.

method.name: search
method.description: Filters the data using the provided parameter and rebinds drop-down list.

parameter.name: word
parameter.description: The value to search for.

method.name: select
method.description: Selects drop-down list item and sets the text of the combobox control.

parameter.name: li
parameter.description: The list item element to select.

method.name: close
method.description: Closes the drop-down list.

method.name: focus
method.description: Gives focus to the input element of the control.

class.name: Telerik.UI.RadChart
class.description: A charting control that can visualize different chart types.

constructor.description: Creates a new RadChart control.

parameter.name: element
parameter.description: The HTML element this control is associated with.

parameter.name: options
parameter.description: The initialization options for this control.

property.name: dataSource
property.description: Gets or sets the data source object for this control.

property.name: autoBind
property.description: Indicates whether the chart will call read on the DataSource initially.

property.name: transitions
property.description: Enables or disables transitions. True by default.

property.name: theme
property.description: Gets or sets the visual theme of the chart.

property.name: seriesColors
property.description: Gets or sets the color collection that will be used for styling the chart series. Array elements must be valid CSS color definitions.

property.name: background
property.description: Gets or sets the background of the chart area.

property.name: opacity
property.description: Gets or sets the background opacity of the chart area.

property.name: border
property.description: Gets the border settings of the chart area.

property.name: width
property.description: Gets or sets the width of the chart area in pixels.

property.name: height
property.description: Gets or sets the height of the chart area in pixels.

property.name: margin
property.description: Gets the margin settings of the chart area.

property.name: title
property.description: Gets the title settings of the chart.

property.name: legend
property.description: Gets the legend settings of the chart.

property.name: panes
property.description: The chart panes configuration. Panes are used to split the chart in two or more parts. The panes are ordered from top to bottom. Each axis can be associated with a pane by setting its pane option to the name of the desired pane. Axis that don't have specified pane are placed in the top (default) pane. Series are moved to the desired pane by associating them with an axis.

property.name: tooltip
property.description: Gets the tooltip settings of the chart.

property.name: plotArea
property.description: Gets the plot are settings.

property.name: axisDefaults
property.description: Gets the default settings that apply to all axes.

property.name: valueAxis
property.description: Gets the value axis settings.

property.name: valueAxes
property.description: Gets the array of all value axis defined for the chart.

property.name: categoryAxis
property.description: Gets the category axis settings.

property.name: categoryAxes
property.description: Gets the array of all category axes defined for the chart.

property.name: xAxis
property.description: Gets the X axis settings when a scatter chart type is used.

property.name: xAxes
property.description: Gets the array of all X axis defined for the chart.

property.name: yAxis
property.description: Gets the Y axis settings when a scatter chart type is used.

property.name: yAxes
property.description: Gets the array of all Y axis defined for the chart.

property.name: seriesDefaults
property.description: Gets the default settings common to all series.

property.name: series
property.description: Gets or sets the data series in the chart.

property.name: svg
property.description: Gets the SVG representation of the current chart.

property.name: element
property.description: Gets the DOM element that hosts this control.

property.name: initialized
property.description: Indicates whether the control is initialized.

event.name: axislabelclick
event.description: Fires when an axis label is clicked.

event.name: databound
event.description: Fires immediately after the control is databound.

event.name: dragstart
event.description: Fires when the user has used the mouse or a swipe gesture to drag the chart.

event.name: drag
event.description: Fires as long as the user is dragging the chart using the mouse or swipe gestures.

event.name: dragend
event.description: Fires when the user stops dragging the chart.

event.name: legenditemclick
event.description: Fires when a series in the chart legend is clicked.

event.name: legenditemhover
event.description: Fires when a series in the chart legend is hovered.

event.name: plotareaclick
event.description: Fires when the plot area is clicked.

event.name: seriesclick
event.description: Fires when any of the chart series is clicked.

event.name: serieshover
event.description: Fires when any of the chart series is hovered.

event.name: zoomstart
event.description: Fires when the user has used the mousewheel to zoom the chart.

event.name: zoom
event.description: Fires as long as the user is zooming the chart using the mousewheel.

event.name: zoomend
event.description: Fires when the user stops zooming the chart.

event.name: selectstart
event.description: Fires when the user starts modifying the axis selection.

event.name: select
event.description: Fires when the user modifies the selection.

event.name: selectend
event.description: Fires when the user completes modifying the selection.

method.name: refresh
method.description: Reloads the data and repaints the chart.

method.name: redraw
method.description: Repaints the chart.

class.name: Telerik.UI.RadGrid
class.description: A grid control that can display and edit data.

constructor.description: Creates a new RadGrid control.

parameter.name: element
parameter.description: The HTML element this control is associated with.

parameter.name: options
parameter.description: The initialization options for this control.

property.name: scrollable
property.description: Enable/disable scrolling. Possible values are "none", "enabled" and "virtual".

property.name: owner
property.description: Gets the owner RadGrid instance.

property.name: parentRow
property.description: Gets the parent row of the table if it is nested.

property.name: parentTable
property.description: Gets the parent row of the table if it is nested.

property.name: detailTables
property.description: Gets an array of all initialized child tables for this table.

property.name: detailTable
property.description: Gets or sets the options for the detail tables. All newly initialized detail tables will inherit these options automatically.

property.name: parentRelation
property.description: Gets the parent relations for this table as an object or an array of objects in the form: { masterField: 'field1', detailField: 'field2' }. To configure parent relations, set the detailTable.parentRelation property of the parent table.

property.name: autoBind
property.description: Indicates whether the grid will call read on the DataSource initially.

property.name: columns
property.description: A collection of column objects or collection of strings that represents the name of the fields.

property.name: dataSource
property.description: Gets or sets the data source object for this control.

property.name: detailTemplate
property.description: Template to be used for rendering the detail rows.

property.name: rowTemplate
property.description: Template to be used for rendering the rows.

property.name: altRowTemplate
property.description: Template to be used for rendering the alternating rows.

property.name: height
property.description: Sets the height of the grid.

property.name: groupable
property.description: Indicates whether grouping is enabled.

property.name: selectable
property.description: Indicates whether selection is enabled.

property.name: selection
property.description: Gets or sets selected rows/cells.

property.name: editable
property.description: Gets and sets the editing related (create/update/delete) options.

property.name: sortable
property.description: Indicates whether sorting is enabled.

property.name: resizable
property.description: Indicates whether column resizing is enabled/disable.

property.name: filterable
property.description: Indicates whether filtering is enabled/disabled.

property.name: reorderable
property.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether column reordering is enabled.

property.name: navigatable
property.description: Indicates whether keboard navigation is enabled/disabled.

property.name: messages
property.description: Gets the localization messages used by the control.

property.name: element
property.description: Gets the DOM element that hosts this control.

property.name: initialized
property.description: Indicates whether the control is initialized.

event.name: cancel
event.description: Fired when the user clicks the cancel "X" button while editing a grid row/column.

event.name: change
event.description: Fires when the grid selection has changed.

event.name: columnmenuinit
event.description: Fired when the column menu is initialized.

event.name: columnresize
event.description: Fires when the user resizes a column.

event.name: databinding
event.description: Fires when the grid is about to receive data from the data source.

event.name: databound
event.description: Fires when the grid has received data from the data source.

event.name: detailcollapse
event.description: Fires when the grid detail row is collapsed.

event.name: detailexpand
event.description: Fires when the grid detail row is expanded.

event.name: detailinit
event.description: Fires when the grid detail is initialized.

event.name: edit
event.description: Fires when the grid enters edit mode.

event.name: filtermenuinit
event.description: Fired when the grid filter menu is initialized.

event.name: remove
event.description: Fires before the grid item is removed.

event.name: save
event.description: Fires before the grid item is changed.

event.name: savechanges
event.description: Fires before the grid calls DataSource sync.

method.name: clearSelection
method.description: Clears currently selected items.

method.name: collapseGroup
method.description: Collapses specified group.

parameter.name: element
parameter.description: Target group item to collapse.

method.name: collapseRow
method.description: Collapses specified master row.

parameter.name: element
parameter.description: Target master row to collapse.

method.name: dataItem
method.description: Returns the data item to which a given table row (tr DOM element) is bound.

parameter.name: element
parameter.description: Target row.

method.name: expandGroup
method.description: Expands specified group.

parameter.name: element
parameter.description: Target group item to expand.

method.name: expandRow
method.description: Expands specified master row.

parameter.name: element
parameter.description: Target master row to expand.

method.name: hideColumn
method.description: Hides the specified column.

parameter.name: column
parameter.description: The index or the bound field of the column to hide.

method.name: refresh
method.description: Reloads the data and repaints the control.

method.name: reorderColumn
method.description: Changes the position of the specified column.

parameter.name: destIndex
parameter.description: Destination column index

parameter.name: column
parameter.description: Column index, DOM element or array element from columns option

method.name: showColumn
method.description: Shows the specified column.

parameter.name: column
parameter.description: The index or the bound field of the column to show.

method.name: editCell
method.description: Switches the specified table cell in edit mode. Requires editable: { mode: "cell" }.

parameter.name: cell
parameter.description: The cell to edit.

class.name: Telerik.UI.RadDatePicker
class.description: Allows the selection of a date value from maximum three different components: year/month/day via intuitive and easy to use vertical looping lists that show in a popup.

constructor.description: Create a new RadDatePicker control that allows selection of a date using year/month/day pickers.

parameter.name: element
parameter.description: The HTML element this control is associated with.

parameter.name: options
parameter.description: The initialization options for this control.

property.name: step
property.description: Gets or sets an object with the step values of the year, month and day lists of the control.

property.name: value
property.description: Gets or sets the value of the picker. (Only the date/time part of the Date object will be applied.) It can be null/undefined (not set).

property.name: valueString
property.description: Gets the string representation of the current value. The string representation is the current value formatted according to the settings of the device and the control.

property.name: minValue
property.description: Gets or sets the minimum value of the value range for the control. (Only the date/time part of the Date object will be applied.)

property.name: maxValue
property.description: Gets or sets the maximum value of the value range for the control. (Only the date/time part of the Date object will be applied.)

property.name: itemCount
property.description: Gets or sets the number of items visible within the selector part of the control. This property is used to determine the height of the selector part when opened. The calculated height will not exceed the height of the view port. Pass non-positive value to stretch the selector vertically. Default value is 3.

property.name: itemLength
property.description: Gets or sets the length (width and height; in pixels) of the items that appear in the selector part of the control. Default value is 70.

property.name: itemSpacing
property.description: Gets or sets the spacing (in pixels) between the items that appear in the selector part of the control. This propery also determines the spacing between the different parts of the selector, e.g. lists, buttons, header. Default value is 10.

property.name: selectorFormat
property.description: Gets or sets the selector format. This value defines how the different selector components will be ordered. By setting this property, you can also define which editable parts of the selector will be visible. For example 'y/m' will display the Year and Month components in a DatePicker. Valid values are: * h - hour, m - minute, t - period [AM/PM] if applicable for a TimePicker; * y - year, m - month, d - day for a DatePicker;

property.name: selectorDefaultValue
property.description: Gets or sets the value that represents the default value displayed in the selector part. The default value is shown when the value property is not set (null/undefined). If no default value is specified, the current date/time on the system is displayed when the selector opens.

property.name: isSelectorOpen
property.description: Gets or sets a value determining whether the selector part of the control is open.

property.name: isReadOnly
property.description: Gets or sets a value determining whether the control is in read only mode. If set to true, the control does not allow the user to modify its value.

property.name: displayValueFormat
property.description: Gets or sets a string representing the value format for the control. The value format determines how the edited value is displayed on the screen after it has been selected. If not set, the format from the current system clock configuration is used.

property.name: autoSizeWidth
property.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the control will automatically calculate its picker width, so that it equals the width of the selector part.

property.name: closeSelectorOnBlur
property.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the data/time selector will be closed automatically on blur. Default value is true.

property.name: enabled
property.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the control is enabled (default).

property.name: itemTemplate
property.description: Gets or sets a value determining how the items in all lists in the selector will be rendered. With this propery the default template can be overridden. Internally all items are bound to a data object having two fields: 'value' and 'label'. These correspond to the number of year, month, hour, etc. and to the name of the month, day and whether the year is leap respectively. In order to utilize either or both of the data object properties the template should have mappings to them, e.g. #= value #'#= label #'

property.name: selectorHeader
property.description: Gets or sets the header displayed in the selector. By default the 'Select Date' text is shown. This property value can be either a string or a data object. If the value is an object, the selectorHeaderTemplate property must also be set to specify which properties of the object will be rendered.

property.name: selectorHeaderTemplate
property.description: Gets or sets a value determining how the selectorHeader property value will be rendered. If the selectorHeader property is of a primitive type, this property should not be set - the value will render as text. If the selectorHeader is an object the template should specify mappings in the form #= objectPropertyName #. Example: #= value # provided that the selectorHeader property is set to { value: 'Header Text' }.

property.name: header
property.description: Gets or sets the object that represents the header content. This property value can be either a string or a data object. If the value is an object, the headerTemplate property must also be set to specify which properties of the object will be rendered.

property.name: headerTemplate
property.description: Gets or sets a value determining how the header property value will be rendered. If the header property is of a primitive type, this property should not be set - the value will render as text. If the header is an object the template should specify mappings in the form #= objectPropertyName #. Example: #= value # provided that the header property is set to { value: 'Header Text' }.

property.name: emptyContent
property.description: Gets or sets the empty content of the picker part of the control. The empty content is displayed when there is no value defined. This property value can be either a string or a data object. If the value is an object, the headerTemplate property must also be set to specify which properties of the object will be rendered.

property.name: emptyContentTemplate
property.description: Gets or sets a value determining how the emptyContent property value will be rendered. If the emptyContent property is of a primitive type, this property should not be set - the value will render as text. If the emptyContent is an object the template should specify mappins in the form #= objectPropertyName #. Example: #= value # provided that the emptyContent property is set to { value: 'Empty' }.

property.name: tabIndex
property.description: Gets or sets the tab index of the control. The default value is -1.

property.name: displayMode
property.description: Specifies the rendering and functioning mode of the control. Accepts values from the enums RadDatePicker.DisplayMode and RadTimePicker.DisplayMode. (Both enums are one and the same - they are available in both places for convenience. Default value is DisplayMode.standard.

property.name: culture
property.description: BCP-47 language tag with language and region. For example: en-US, fr-FR, ar-KW

property.name: element
property.description: Gets the DOM element that hosts this control.

property.name: initialized
property.description: Indicates whether the control is initialized.

event.name: open
event.description: Fires after the selector popup opens.

event.name: close
event.description: Fires after the selecotr popup closes.

event.name: change
event.description: Fires when the date is changed via the selector.

class.name: Telerik.UI.RadTimePicker
class.description: Allows the selection of a time value from maximum three different components: hour/minute/perio via intuitive and easy to use vertical looping lists that show in a popup.

constructor.description: Create a new RadTimePicker control that allows selection of a time using hour/minute/period pickers.

parameter.name: element
parameter.description: The HTML element that hosts this control.

parameter.name: options
parameter.description: The initialization options for this control.

property.name: baseDate
property.description: Gets or sets the Date object, which date components (year, month, day) will be used as base for the Date object returned by the value property. Default value is null; in this case the value property returns a Date object with date components equal to today's.

property.name: minuteStep
property.description: Gets or sets the step value of the minute list of the control.

property.name: value

class.name: Telerik.UI.RadCalendar
class.description: A calendar control for picking dates, with navigation.

constructor.description: Creates a new RadCalendar control.

parameter.name: element
parameter.description: The HTML element this control is associated with.

parameter.name: options
parameter.description: The initialization options for this control.

property.name: culture
property.description: Gets or sets the culture of the calendar.

property.name: dates
property.description: Specifies a list of dates, which will be passed to the month template. Default value is [].

property.name: depth
property.description: Specifies the navigation depth. Valid values are: 'month', 'year', 'decade', 'century'. Default value is "month".

property.name: footer
property.description: Configuration options for the footer.

property.name: max
property.description: Specifies the maximum date, which the calendar can show. Default value is Date(2099, 11, 31).

property.name: min
property.description: Specifies the minimum date, which the calendar can show. Default value is Date(1900, 0, 1).

property.name: month
property.description: Templates for the cells rendered in the "month" view.

property.name: view
property.description: Gets or sets the current view. Valid values are: 'month', 'year', 'decade', 'century'. Default value is "month".

property.name: current
property.description: Returns the currently focused date.

property.name: selection
property.description: Configures the selection mode of the control.

property.name: value
property.description: Specifies the selected date. Default value is null.

property.name: selectedDateRange
property.description: Gets or sets an object that contains the start and end date of the current selection. Use this property when the selection mode is "singleRange". The object has two properties: start and end, which are of type Date.

property.name: selectedDateRanges
property.description: Gets or sets an array of objects containing the start and end dates of each selected range. The elements of the array have two properties: start and end, which are of type Date. Use this property when the selection mode is "multipleRanges".

property.name: element
property.description: Gets the DOM element that hosts this control.

property.name: initialized
property.description: Indicates whether the control is initialized.

event.name: change
event.description: Fires when the selected date is changed.

event.name: navigate
event.description: Fires when the control navigates.

method.name: navigate
method.description: Navigates to the value in the specified view. View defaults to 'month'. Value defaults to today.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: The value to navigate to.

parameter.name: view
parameter.description: The view to navigate to.

method.name: navigateDown
method.description: Navigates with one step to a more specific period view.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: The value to navigate to.

method.name: navigateToFuture
method.description: Navigates to the next period (e.g. month, year, century, decade).

method.name: navigateToPast
method.description: Navigates to the previous period (e.g. month, year, century, decade).

method.name: navigateUp
method.description: Navigates with one step to a more general period view.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: The value to navigate to.

class.name: Telerik.UI.RadScheduler
class.description: Scheduler control - CTP version

constructor.description: Creates a new RadScheduler control.

parameter.name: element
parameter.description: The HTML element this control is associated with.

parameter.name: options
parameter.description: The initialization options for this control.

property.name: messages
property.description: Gets the localization messages used by the control.

property.name: allDayEventTemplate
property.description: Gets or sets the template to be used to render the "all day" scheduler events. The fields which can be used in the template are: description [String] - the event description; end [Date] - the event end date; isAllDay [Boolean] - if true the event is "all day"; resources [Array] - the event resources; start [Date] - the event start date; title [String] - the event title

property.name: allDaySlot
property.description: If set to true the scheduler will display a slot for "all day" events.

property.name: dataSource
property.description: Gets or sets the data source object for the scheduler.

property.name: date
property.description: The current date of the scheduler. Used to determine the period which is displayed by the control.

property.name: dateHeaderTemplate
property.description: The template used to render the date header cells. By default the scheduler renders the date using the current culture date format. The fields which can be used in the template are: date [Date] - represents the major tick date.

property.name: editable
property.description: Gets and sets the editing related (create/update/delete) options for the scheduler.

property.name: endTime
property.description: The end time of the week and day views. The scheduler will display events ending before the endTime.

property.name: eventTemplate
property.description: The template used to render the scheduler events. The fields which can be used in the template are: description [String] - the event description; end [Date] - the event end date; resources [Array] - the event resources; start [Date] - the event start date; title [String] - the event title

property.name: group
property.description: The configuration of the scheduler resource(s) grouping.

property.name: height
property.description: Sets the height of the scheduler.

property.name: majorTick
property.description: The number of minutes represented by a major tick.

property.name: majorTimeHeaderTemplate
property.description: The template used to render the major ticks. By default the scheduler renders the time using the current culture date format. The fields which can be used in the template are: date [Date] - represents the major tick date.

property.name: minorTickCount
property.description: The number of time slots to display per major tick.

property.name: minorTimeHeaderTemplate
property.description: The template used to render the minor ticks. By default the scheduler renders a space " ". The fields which can be used in the template are: date [Date] - represents the major tick date.

property.name: resources
property.description: The configuration of the scheduler resource(s). A scheduler resource is optional metadata that can be associated with a scheduler event.

property.name: selectable
property.description: If set to true the user would be able to select scheduler cells and events. By default selection is disabled.

property.name: startTime
property.description: The start time of the week and day views. The scheduler will display events starting after the startTime.

property.name: timezone
property.description: The timezone which the scheduler will use to display the scheduler appointment dates. By default the current system timezone is used. This is an acceptable default when the scheduler control is bound to local array of events. It is advisable to specify a timezone if the scheduler is bound to a remote service. That way all users would see the same dates and times no matter their configured system timezone.

property.name: view
property.description: Gets the current scheduler view object.

property.name: views
property.description: The views displayed by the scheduler and their configuration. The array items can be either objects specifying the view configuration or strings representing the view types (assuming default configuration). By default the RadScheduler control displays "day" and "week" views.

property.name: width
property.description: Sets the width of the scheduler.

property.name: element
property.description: Gets the DOM element that hosts this control.

property.name: initialized
property.description: Indicates whether the control is initialized.

event.name: remove
event.description: Fired when the user clicks the "destroy" button.

event.name: edit
event.description: Fired when the user opens a scheduler event in edit mode by or creates a new event.

event.name: cancel
event.description: Fired when the user cancels editing by clicking the "cancel" button.

event.name: save
event.description: Fired when the user saves a scheduler event by clicking the "save" button.

event.name: add
event.description: Fired when the a new event is about to be added.

event.name: databinding
event.description: Fired before the scheduler binds to its data source.

event.name: databound
event.description: Fired after the scheduler binds to its data source.

event.name: movestart
event.description: Fired when the user starts to drag an event.

event.name: move
event.description: Fired when the user is moving an event.

event.name: moveend
event.description: Fired when the user stops moving an event.

event.name: resizestart
event.description: Fired when the user starts to resize an event.

event.name: resize
event.description: Fired when the user is resizing an event.

event.name: resizeend
event.description: Fired when the user releases the mouse after resizing an event.

event.name: navigate
event.description: Fired when the user changes selected date, view or of the scheduler.

method.name: refresh
method.description: This function is used to redraw the scheduler control and refresh its data.

method.name: addEvent
method.description: Adds a new scheduler event and opens the edit form.

parameter.name: data
parameter.description: The object containing the scheduler event fields.

method.name: cancelEvent
method.description: Cancels the scheduler event editing. Closes the edit form.

method.name: editEvent
method.description: Opens the specified scheduler event in the edit form.

parameter.name: event
parameter.description: The event which should be put in edit mode. Value should be a string which is the uid of the event which should be edited.

method.name: removeEvent
method.description: Removes the specified scheduler event.

parameter.name: event
parameter.description: The event which should be removed. Value should be a string which is the uid of the event which should be removed.

method.name: saveEvent
method.description: Saves the scheduler event which is open in the edit form and closes it.

method.name: setView
method.description: Sets the scheduler view to the one with the specified name.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The name of the scheduler view (e.g. "month").

class.name: Telerik.UI.RadColorPicker
class.description: A ColorPicker control.

constructor.description: ColorPicker control.

parameter.name: element
parameter.description: The HTML element this control is associated with.

parameter.name: options
parameter.description: The initialization options for this control.

property.name: color
property.description: Like value(), but it returns a Color object. This does not trigger the "change" event.

property.name: value
property.description: Get or set the selected color. If no argument is given, this returns the currently selected color as a string in format #FFFFFF when the opacity option is off, or rgba(255, 255, 255, 1) when opacity is requested. If one argument is given, it selects the new color and updates the UI. The argument can be a string in hex, rgb or rbga format, or a Color object. This does not trigger the "change" event. Returns the string representation of the current color.

property.name: previousColor
property.description: Get or set the previous color. Returns the string representation of the previous color.

property.name: opacity
property.description: Enable or disable opacity. Only for the HSB and RGB pickers.

property.name: opacityValue
property.description: Get or set opacity. The values are between 0 and 1. This does not trigger the "change" event. Only for the HSB and RGB pickers.

property.name: brightness
property.description: Get or set brightness. The values are between 0 and 100. Only for the HSB picker.

property.name: width
property.description: Get or set the width of the pop-up.

property.name: defaultPalette
property.description: Get or set the default pre-defined palette of colors. It can be an array of Telerik.Utilities.color objects or of strings that parseColor understands. Only for the Palette picker.

property.name: palette
property.description: Get or set the pre-defined palette of colors. It can be an array of Telerik.Utilities.color objects or of strings that parseColor understands. Only for the Palette picker.

class.name: Telerik.UI.RadHSBPicker
class.description: A ColorPicker control.

constructor.description: HSB ColorPicker control.

parameter.name: element
parameter.description: The HTML element this control is associated with.

parameter.name: options
parameter.description: The initialization options for this control.

property.name: color
property.description: Like value(), but it returns a Color object. This does not trigger the "change" event.

property.name: value
property.description: Get or set the selected color. If no argument is given, this returns the currently selected color as a string in format #FFFFFF when the opacity option is off, or rgba(255, 255, 255, 1) when opacity is requested. If one argument is given, it selects the new color and updates the UI. The argument can be a string in hex, rgb or rgba format, or a Color object. This does not trigger the "change" event. Returns the string representation of the current color.

property.name: previousColor
property.description: Get or set the previous color. Returns the string representation of the previous color.

property.name: opacity
property.description: Enable or disable opacity.

property.name: opacityValue
property.description: Get or set opacity. The values are between 0 and 1. This does not trigger the "change" event.

property.name: brightness
property.description: Get or set brightness. The values are between 0 and 100.

property.name: tooltip
property.description: Enables or disables tooltips.

property.name: transitions
property.description: Enables or disables transitions.

property.name: width
property.description: Get or set the width of the control. When opacity is off the minimal width of the control is 350px. When opacity is on the minimal width is 450px.

property.name: element
property.description: Gets the DOM element that hosts this control.

property.name: initialized
property.description: Indicates whether the control is initialized.

event.name: change
event.description: Fires when a color was selected

event.name: select
event.description: Fires while selecting a color

class.name: Telerik.UI.RadAutoCompleteBox
class.description: A textbox providing text suggestions.

constructor.description: Creates a new RadAutoCompleteBox control.

parameter.name: element
parameter.description: The HTML element this control is associated with.

parameter.name: options
parameter.description: The initialization options for this control.

property.name: text
property.description: Gets or sets the value of the control.

property.name: filter
property.description: Gets or sets the type of filtration to use when filtering the data items. Possible values include "startswith", "endswith", "contains", "eq", "neq". Default value is "startswith".

property.name: minLength
property.description: Gets or sets the minimum amount of characters that should be typed before RadAutoCompleteBox queries the dataSource.

property.name: placeholder
property.description: Gets or sets the string that appears in the textbox when it has no value.

property.name: autoSuggest
property.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether RadAutoCompleteBox should automatically auto-type the rest of text.

property.name: highlightFirst
property.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether RadAutoCompleteBox should automatically highlight the first shown item. Default value is false.

property.name: separator
property.description: Gets or sets the separator for completion. Empty by default, allowing for only one completion.

property.name: value
property.description: Gets or sets the value of the control.

property.name: animation
property.description: Gets the animation options to be used for opening/closing the popup.

property.name: autoBind
property.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to bind the widget to the dataSource on initialization.

property.name: dataSource
property.description: Gets or sets the data source of the control.

property.name: dataTextField
property.description: Gets or sets the field of the data item that provides the text content of the list items.

property.name: delay
property.description: Gets or sets the delay in ms after which the control will start filtering the dataSource.

property.name: enabled
property.description: Gets or sets the enabled state of the control.

property.name: height
property.description: Gets or sets the height of the drop-down list in pixels.

property.name: headerTemplate
property.description: Specifies a static HTML content, which will be rendered as a header of the popup element.

property.name: template
property.description: Gets or sets the template to be used for rendering the items in the list.

property.name: ignoreCase
property.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the search should be case sensitive.

property.name: isOpen
property.description: Gets a value indicating whether the list container is currently open.

property.name: readonly
property.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the control is read-only.

property.name: list
property.description: Gets the jQuery-wrapped list of items in the control.

property.name: element
property.description: Gets the DOM element that hosts this control.

property.name: initialized
property.description: Indicates whether the control is initialized.

event.name: open
event.description: Fires when the drop-down list of RadAutoComplete is shown.

event.name: close
event.description: Fires when the drop-down list of RadAutoComplete is closed.

event.name: select
event.description: Fires when an item is selected from the drop-down list.

event.name: change
event.description: Fires when the value of the RadAutoComplete changes.

event.name: databinding
event.description: Fires when the control is about to databind.

event.name: databound
event.description: Fires immediately after the control is databound.

method.name: suggest
method.description: Forces a suggestion onto the text of the AutoComplete.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: Characters to force a suggestion.

method.name: dataItem
method.description: Returns the raw data record at the specified index or the selected index.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: Optional. The zero-based index of the data record to retrieve.

method.name: refresh
method.description: Re-renders the items in the drop-down list.

method.name: search
method.description: Filters the data using the provided parameter and rebinds drop-down list.

parameter.name: word
parameter.description: The value to search for.

method.name: select
method.description: Selects drop-down list item and sets the text of the combobox control.

parameter.name: li
parameter.description: The list item element to select.

method.name: close
method.description: Closes the drop-down list.

method.name: focus
method.description: Gives focus to the input element of the control.

class.name: Telerik.UI.RadLinearGauge
class.description: A linear gauge control that can visualize a value on a linear scale.

constructor.description: Creates a new RadLinearGauge control.

parameter.name: element
parameter.description: The HTML element this control is associated with.

parameter.name: options
parameter.description: The initialization options for this control.

property.name: mirror
property.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the scale labels and ticks are mirrored. Mirroring the scale will render the labels and ticks on the opposite side.

property.name: vertical
property.description: Gets or sets the position of the gauge.

property.name: line
property.description: Provides access to the line options of the linear gauge.

property.name: pointer
property.description: Retrieves the gauge pointer settings.

property.name: theme
property.description: Gets or sets the name of the visual theme applied to the gauge.

property.name: background
property.description: Gets or sets the background of the gauge area. Any valid CSS color string is accepted.

property.name: border
property.description: Gets the border settings of the gauge area.

property.name: width
property.description: Gets the width of the gauge area.

property.name: height
property.description: Gets the height of the gauge area.

property.name: margin
property.description: Gets the margin of the gauge area.

property.name: transitions
property.description: Enables or disables transitions. True by default.

property.name: labels
property.description: Retrieves the label settings for this gauge.

property.name: minorUnit
property.description: Gets or sets the interval between minor divisions

property.name: majorUnit
property.description: Gets or sets the interval between major divisions

property.name: min
property.description: Gets or sets the minimum value of the scale.

property.name: max
property.description: Gets or sets the maximum value of the scale.

property.name: reverse
property.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the axis direction is reversed. Reversed axis values increase from right to left and from top to bottom.

property.name: majorTicks
property.description: Retrieves the major tick settings.

property.name: minorTicks
property.description: Retrieves the minor tick settings.

property.name: ranges
property.description: Gets or sets the array of ranges that will appear on the scale.

property.name: rangeSize
property.description: The width of the ranges that will appear on the scale. If the property is not set, it will be calculated to 10% of the scale radius.

property.name: rangePlaceholderColor
property.description: Gets or sets the default color for the ranges.

property.name: svg
property.description: Gets the SVG representation of the current gauge.

property.name: value
property.description: Gets or sets the current gauge value.

property.name: element
property.description: Gets the DOM element that hosts this control.

property.name: initialized
property.description: Indicates whether the control is initialized.

method.name: redraw
method.description: Redraws the gauge.

class.name: Telerik.UI.RadHubTile
class.description: RadHubTile is the most commonly used tile. It consists of a title, an icon, a notification count and an optional message.

constructor.description: Creates a new RadHubTile control.

parameter.name: element
parameter.description: The HTML element this control is associated with.

parameter.name: options
parameter.description: The initialization options for this control.

property.name: notification
property.description: Gets or sets the notification count of the tile.

property.name: imageSource
property.description: Gets or sets the source of the tile image.

property.name: message
property.description: Gets or sets the message of the tile.

property.name: updateInterval
property.description: Gets or sets the UpdateInterval in seconds. This interval determines how often the tile will update its visual states when it is not frozen.

property.name: updateDeviation
property.description: Gets or sets the update deviation in seconds. The number will be used to make each update happen at random intervals from (updateInterval-updateDeviation) to (updateInterval+updateDeviation). For example, with updateInterval=5 and updateDeviation=2, the update can happen at any time between 3 and 7 seconds.

property.name: isFrozen
property.description: Gets or sets the IsFrozen property. Freezing a hub tile means that it will cease to periodically update itself. For example when it is offscreen.

property.name: title
property.description: Gets or sets the Title.

property.name: backContentTemplate
property.description: Gets or sets a value determining what the backside of the tile will render. The value can be either a string with HTML or a DOM element. If the value is an element, its inner HTML will be used as the template.

property.name: element
property.description: Gets the DOM element that hosts this control.

property.name: initialized
property.description: Indicates whether the control is initialized.

method.name: flip
method.description: Flips the tile between its front and back sides. This method is called automatically if the tile update interval is set and the tile is not frozen. Note that the tile will not flip if there is another animation in progress (e.g. slide) or if the back tile has no content.

class.name: Telerik.UI.RadCustomHubTile
class.description: RadCustomHubTile defines a hub tile with custom front and back contents and a swivel transition between them.

constructor.description: Creates a new RadCustomHubTile control.

parameter.name: element
parameter.description: The HTML element this control is associated with.

parameter.name: options
parameter.description: The initialization options for this control.

property.name: frontContentTemplate
property.description: Gets or sets a value determining what the backside of the tile will render. The value can be either a string with HTML or a DOM element. If the value is an element, its inner HTML will be used as the template.

property.name: updateInterval
property.description: Gets or sets the UpdateInterval in seconds. This interval determines how often the tile will update its visual states when it is not frozen.

property.name: updateDeviation
property.description: Gets or sets the update deviation in seconds. The number will be used to make each update happen at random intervals from (updateInterval-updateDeviation) to (updateInterval+updateDeviation). For example, with updateInterval=5 and updateDeviation=2, the update can happen at any time between 3 and 7 seconds.

property.name: isFrozen
property.description: Gets or sets the IsFrozen property. Freezing a hub tile means that it will cease to periodically update itself. For example when it is offscreen.

property.name: title
property.description: Gets or sets the Title.

property.name: backContentTemplate

property.description: Gets or sets the update deviation in seconds. The number will be used to make each update happen at random intervals from (updateInterval-updateDeviation) to (updateInterval+updateDeviation). class.name: Telerik.UI.RadRadialMenu
class.description: Displays a radial context menu.

constructor.description: Initializes a new RadRadialMenu instance from the provided HTML element and options.

parameter.name: element
parameter.description: The HTML element this control is associated with.

parameter.name: options
parameter.description: The initialization options for this control.

property.name: popup
property.description: Gets the popup element that contains the radial menu elements.

property.name: startAngle
property.description: Gets or sets the start angle of the first radial sector in the menu.

property.name: radius
property.description: Gets or sets the radius of the radial menu.

property.name: visible
property.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the menu is visible.

property.name: target
property.description: Gets or sets the target HTML element or CSS selector for which the radial menu will be shown. If null, the menu popup is positioned at the control's element location.

property.name: trigger
property.description: Gets or sets the target element's trigger action that will show this menu. This property requires that a valid target is specified. Available options are "tap", "hover", "focus", "select" and "none". Default is "tap".

property.name: position
property.description: Gets or sets the position of the radial menu relative to the target HTML element. This property requires that a valid target is specified. Accepted values are "top", "bottom", "left", "right", "center", "top left", "top right", "bottom left" and "bottom right". Default value is "right".

property.name: offsetLeft
property.description: Gets or sets the left offset of the radial menu in pixels relative to the target HTML element and specified position. This property requires that a valid target is specifies.

property.name: offsetTop
property.description: Gets or sets the top offset of the radial menu in pixels relative to the target HTML element and specified position. This property requires that a valid target is specifies.

property.name: expanded
property.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the menu is expanded.

property.name: autoCollapse
property.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the menu will automatically collapse when the user taps outside of its bounding circle.

property.name: transitions
property.description: Enables or disables menu transitions.

property.name: background
property.description: Gets or sets the outer circle background color.

property.name: border
property.description: Gets or sets the outer circle border color.

property.name: innerBackground
property.description: Gets or sets the inner circle background color.

property.name: center
property.description: Gets or sets the center item.

property.name: items
property.description: Gets or sets all the items in the menu.

property.name: element
property.description: Gets the DOM element that hosts this control.

property.name: initialized
property.description: Indicates whether the control is initialized.

event.name: action
event.description: Fires when a menu item is tapped.

event.name: select
event.description: Fires when a menu item is selected.

event.name: deselect
event.description: Fires when a menu item is deselected.

event.name: navigate
event.description: Fires when the user navigates to another menu view.

event.name: expand
event.description: Fires when the radial menu is expanded.

event.name: collapse
event.description: Fires when the radial menu is collapsed.

event.name: show
event.description: Fires when the radial menu is shown.

event.name: hide
event.description: Fires when the radial menu is hidden.

method.name: getCurrentItems
method.description: Retrieves the current visible items in the menu.

method.name: getAllItems
method.description: Retrieves all items in the menu.

method.name: getItem
method.description: Finds an item by the specified id.

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: The id of the item to find.

method.name: toggle
method.description: Toggles between expanded and collapsed states in the menu.

parameter.name: expanded
parameter.description: Optional. The expanded state that the menu will take.

method.name: navigate
method.description: Navigates to the child items of a specified menu item.

parameter.name: item
parameter.description: The menu item instance whose child items to navigate to.

method.name: back
method.description: Navigates back to a parent view.

parameter.name: top
parameter.description: Optional. If true, navigates to the topmost item view. By default, navigates one level back.

method.name: show
method.description: Shows the menu, optionally relative to a target, at a position and offset.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The target HTML element or CSS selector.

parameter.name: position
parameter.description: The position relative to the target HTML element where to display the menu. Accepted values are "top", "bottom", "left", "right", "center", "top left", "top right", "bottom left" and "bottom right".

parameter.name: offsetLeft
parameter.description: The left offset relative to the specified target and position.

parameter.name: offsetTop
parameter.description: The top offset relative to the specified target and position.

method.name: hide
method.description: Hides the menu. If the menu is expanded, collapses it first.

method.name: refresh
method.description: Refreshes the menu by redrawing the elements and triggering transitions.

parameter.name: immediate
parameter.description: Optional. If true, refreshes the control immediately without animation.

class.name: Telerik.UI.RadSlider

constructor.description: Creates a new RadSlider control.

parameter.name: element
parameter.description: The HTML element this control is associated with.

property.description: Gets or sets whether the increase and decrease buttons should be shown.

property.description: Gets or sets the delta with which the value changes when the user presses PageUp or PageDown (the drag handle must be focused).

property.description: Gets or sets the small step value of the slider. The slider value will change when the end user (1) clicks on the increase/decrease buttons, (2) presses the arrow keys (the drag handle must be focused), or (3) drags the drag handle.

property.name: min
property.description: Gets or sets the minimum value of the slider.

property.name: max
property.description: Gets or sets the maximum value of the slider.

property.name: orientation
property.description: Gets or sets the orientation of the slider. Allowed values are "horizontal" or "vertical". Default value is "horizontal".

property.name: tickPlacement
property.description: Gets or sets the location of the tick marks in the slider. The available options are "minorOutside", "minorMajorOutside", "inside" and "none". Default value is "minorMajorOutside".

property.name: tooltip
property.description: Gets the configuration settings for the slider tooltip.

property.name: element
property.description: Gets the DOM element that hosts this control.

property.name: initialized
property.description: Indicates whether the control is initialized.

event.name: change
event.description: Fires when the value of the slider is changed.

event.name: slide
event.description: Fires when the slide handle has moved.

property.name: offsetY

property.name: position
property.description: Gets or sets the position of the chart legend. Accepted values are: "top", "bottom", "left", "right", "custom". When a value of "custom" is used, the legend is positioned using its offsetX and offsetY properties. Default value is "right".

class.name: Telerik.UI.Chart._TooltipConfiguration
class.description: For internal usage only. Describes the properties of a chart tooltip.

constructor.description: For internal usage only. Describes the properties of a chart tooltip.

property.name: background
property.description: Gets or sets the background color of the tooltip. The default value is determined from the series color.

property.name: border
property.description: Gets the tooltip border settings.

property.name: color
property.description: Gets or sets the text color of the tooltip. The default value is determined from the series label color.

property.name: font
property.description: Gets or sets the tooltip font.

property.name: format
property.description: Gets or sets the tooltip format. Format variables depend on the series type: Area, bar, column, funnel, line and pie 0 - value; Bubble, scatter and scatterLine 0 - x value, 1 - y value; Candlestick and OHLC 0 - open value, 1 - high value, 2 - low value, 3 - close value, 4 - category name; For Example: "{0:C}--{1:C}" to show a tooltip on candlestick series for open and high values.

property.name: padding
property.description: Gets the padding settings of the tooltip.

property.name: template
property.description: Gets or sets the template that is used to render the tooltip. Available template variables are value, category, series and dataItem.

property.name: visible
property.description: Gets or sets the tooltip visibility. Default is false.

property.name: shared
property.description: A value indicating if the tooltip should be shared. Default is false.

property.name: sharedTemplate
property.description: The shared tooltip template. Template variables: points - the category points, category - the category name

class.name: Telerik.UI.Chart.Axis
class.description: Represents an axis on a chart.

constructor.description: Represents an axis on a chart.

property.name: axisCrossingValue
property.description: Gets or sets the value at which this axis crosses the perpendicular axis.

property.name: color
property.description: Gets or sets the color to all apply to all axis elements. Individual color settings for line and labels take priority. Any valid CSS color is accepted.

property.name: crosshair
property.description: Gets the axis crosshair settings.

property.name: labels
property.description: Gets the axis label settings.

property.name: line
property.description: Gets the axis line settings.

property.name: majorGridLines
property.description: Gets the major grid line settings.

property.name: minorGridLines
property.description: Gets the minor grid line settings.

property.name: majorTicks
property.description: Gets the major tick settings

property.name: minorTicks
property.description: Gets the minor tick settings

property.name: min
property.description: Gets or sets the minimum value of the axis. This property is often used in combination with the max property to adjust the size of the chart relative to the charting area.

property.name: max
property.description: Gets or sets the maximum value of the axis. This property is often used in combination with the min property to adjust the size of the chart relative to the charting area.

property.name: majorUnit
property.description: Gets or sets the interval between major divisions. For example, on a column chart, this property determines the step size whole going up the vertical axis. You can additionally have minor steps and ticks in between the major ones by adjusting the minorUnit and minorTick.size properties.

property.name: minorUnit
property.description: Gets or sets the interval between minor divisions. For more information, refer to the majorUnit property description.

property.name: name
property.description: Gets or sets the unique axis name.

property.name: narrowRange
property.description: Prevents the automatic axis range from snapping to 0.

property.name: pane
property.description: The name of the pane that the axis should be rendered in. The axis will be rendered in the first (default) pane if not set.

property.name: plotBands
property.description: Gets or sets the plot bands of the axis. Elements of this array must be objects of the form { from:0, to: 100, color: 'navy' }

property.name: reverse
property.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the axis direction is reversed.

property.name: title
property.description: Retrieves the chart axis title settings.

property.name: visible
property.description: Gets or sets the visibility of this axis.

property.name: baseUnit
property.description: Gets or sets the base time interval for the axis when axis values are of Date type. Accepted values are "seconds", "minutes", "hours", "days", "weeks", "months" and "years". The default value is determined automatically from the minimum difference between subsequent categories.

property.name: notes
property.description: Retrieves the chart axis notes settings.

property.description: Gets or sets the array of category names that will be used to label the categories in the chart.

property.description: Gets or sets the field from the objects in the categories array that will be used to retrieve the category name. Use this property when the categories array contains objects instead of primitive types.

property.name: justified
property.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the categories and series are positioned on major ticks. This removes the empty space before and after the series. Default is true. This option is ignored for bar, column, "boxPlot", ohlc or candlestick series.

property.name: weekStartDay
property.description: The week start day when baseUnit is set to "weeks". The value should be a number from 0 to 6 where 0 is Sunday, 1 is Monday and so on. The default value is 0 (Sunday).

property.name: axisCrossingValue

class.name: Telerik.UI.Chart._ErrorBarsConfiguration
class.description: For internal usage only. Describes the properties of the errorBars.

constructor.description: For internal usage only. Describes the properties of the errorBars.

property.name: value
property.description: The error bars value. The value option is supported when series.type is set to "bar", "column", "line" or "area". The following value types are supported: - "stderr" - the standard error of the series values will be used to calculate the point low and high value - "stddev(n)" - the standard deviation of the series values will be used to calculate the point low and high value. A number can be specified between the parentheses, that will be multiplied by the calculated standard deviation. - "percentage(n)" - a percentage of the point value - A number that will be subtracted/added to the point value - An array that holds the low and high difference from the point value - A function that returns the errorBars point value

property.name: xValue
property.description: The xAxis error bars value. The xValue option is supported when series.type is set to "scatter", "scatterLine" or "bubble". The following value types are supported: - "stderr" - the standard error of the series values will be used to calculate the point low and high value - "stddev(n)" - the standard deviation of the series values will be used to calculate the point low and high value. A number can be specified between the parentheses, that will be multiplied by the calculated standard deviation. - "percentage(n)" - a percentage of the point value - A number that will be subtracted/added to the point value - An array that holds the low and high difference from the point value - A function that returns the errorBars point value

property.name: yValue
property.description: The yAxis error bars value. The yValue option is supported when series.type is set to "scatter", "scatterLine" or "bubble". The following value types are supported: - "stderr" - the standard error of the series values will be used to calculate the point low and high value - "stddev(n)" - the standard deviation of the series values will be used to calculate the point low and high value. A number can be specified between the parentheses, that will be multiplied by the calculated standard deviation. - "percentage(n)" - a percentage of the point value - A number that will be subtracted/added to the point value - An array that holds the low and high difference from the point value - A function that returns the errorBars point value

property.name: endCaps
property.description: If set to false, the error bars caps will not be displayed. By default the caps are visible.

property.name: color
property.description: The color of the error bars. Accepts a valid CSS color string, including hex and rgb.

property.name: line
property.description: Gets the line settings for the error bars.

class.name: Telerik.UI.Chart._OutliersConfiguration
class.description: For internal usage only. The chart series outliers configuration.

constructor.description: For internal usage only. The chart series outliers configuration.

property.name: background
property.description: Gets or sets the background color of the series outliers.

property.name: border
property.description: Gets the the color of the border. Accepts a valid CSS color string, including hex and rgb.

property.name: size
property.description: Gets or sets the marker size in pixels.

property.name: type
property.description: Gets or sets the outliers shape. The supported values are: "circle" - the marker shape is circle. "square" - the marker shape is square. "triangle" - the marker shape is triangle. "cross" - the marker shape is cross.

property.name: visible
property.description: If set to true the chart will display the series outliers. By default chart series outliers are not displayed.

property.name: rotation
property.description: Gets or sets the rotation angle of the outliers.

property.description: Gets the type of the series.

property.name: holeSize
property.description: The the radius of the donut hole. If the value is not set, it will be automatically calculated based on the chart size.

property.name: margin
property.description: The margin around each series (not available for the last level of the series).

property.name: size
property.description: The width of the donut ring. If the value is not set, it will be automatically calculated based on the chart size.

property.name: overlayGradient
property.description: Gets or sets the overlay gradient used for this series. Accepted values are "roundedBevel", "glass" and "none".

property.name: categoryField
property.description: Gets or sets the data field containing the sector category name.

property.name: colorField
property.description: Gets or sets the data field containing the sector color.

property.name: explodeField
property.description: Gets or sets the data field containing the boolean value that indicates if the sector is exploded.

property.name: connectors
property.description: Gets the settings for the label connector lines.

property.name: labels
property.description: Gets or sets the settings for the series data labels.

property.name: padding
property.description: Gets the padding value around the pie chart (equal on all sides).

property.name: startAngle
property.description: Gets or sets the start angle of the first pie segment. Default is 90 degrees.

property.name: border
property.description: Gets the border settings for this series.

property.name: color
property.description: Gets or sets the color with which this series is displayed on the plot area.

property.name: stack
property.description: Indicates whether the series should be stacked.

property.name: tooltip
property.description: Retrieves the tooltip settings for this series.

property.name: data
property.description: Gets or sets the array of data points for this series.

property.name: field
property.description: Gets or sets the data field containing the series value.

property.name: groupNameTemplate
property.description: Gets or sets the name template for auto-generated series when binding to grouped data. Template variables: series, group, group.field, group.value.

property.name: name
property.description: Gets or sets the series name visible in the legend.

property.name: visibleInLegend
property.description: Indicates whether to show the series in the legend.

property.name: opacity
property.description: Gets or sets series opacity.

property.name: notes
property.description: Retrieves the chart series notes settings.

property.name: noteTextField
property.description: Gets or sets the data item field which contains the series note text.

property.name: errorLowField
property.description: Gets or sets the data item field which contains the series.errorBars low value. The errorLowField option is supported when series.type is set to "bar", "column", "line" or "area".

property.name: errorHighField
property.description: Gets or sets the data item field which contains the series.errorBars low value. The errorHighField option is supported when series.type is set to "bar", "column", "line" or "area".

property.name: xErrorLowField
property.description: Gets or sets the data item field which contains the series.errorBars low value. The xErrorLowField option is supported when series.type is set to "scatter", "scatterLine" or "bubble".
